result.execSummary:
The defendant Neil N. Roder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Neil N. Roder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Neil N. Roder was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full from cash bond posted

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neil N. Roder

defendant.name: Roder, Neil N.
defendant.address: 1412 Arbor Vitae Ln, Arbor Vitae, WI 54568

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Brandy M. Miller

Case called 8:57 a.m.:  Defendant Neil N. Roder in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15FO603 and 15FO604.  ADA Michlig statement to court - moves to dismiss Disorderly Conduct and defendan tto plead No Contest to Resisting/obstructing charge.  Court questions two forfeiture citations tracking - ADA Michlig moves to dismiss 15FO603 and 15FO604.  Court grants motions to dismiss 15FO603 and 15FO604 and the disorderly conduct charge in 15CM230.  Court questions defendant - defendant pleads guilty to Resisting/Obstructing Charge.   Plea questionnaire & waiver filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Atty Voorhees statement -lower left hand corner of plea questionnaire- defendant made note on it and maybe hard to read- reads what defendant wrote - "if I initial as such, as they request, would it be well with the Creator."  Court questions defendant if that is accurate what he wrote - defendant states that is correct and questions defendant if what he wrote have any impact on the answers he gave on form- defendant statement to that -court interprets that as is not intended to disrupt the proceeding today and is qualifying what he is doing as his religious beliefs.  Court finds defendant guilty of one count of resisting officer and goes to sentencing.  ADA Michlig statement noted defendant was in jail for 20 days and notes witness in this case has moved out of state and asks for court to impose fine.  Atty Voorhees statement - thought State was going to impose costs only and thought defendant posted $500.00 bond.  Court notes that bond was posted for defendant of $500.00.  Atty Voorhees goes off record to talk to defendant's father.  Atty Voorhees statement - notes that defendant's father is an ordained minister and wants court to see that there is alot of family support.  Defendant statement to court.   Court will not impose any more incarceration of probation and states reasons and only imposes Court Costs of $443.00 and will be taken from bond posted and amount to be refunded to whomever posted.   The court informs defendant of DNA sample that is required.  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).  JOC to reflect under to 973.155 that 22 days of credit be given and that court sentences him to 22 days of jail.

4:20 p.m. Defendant Neil N. Roder in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees- no negotiated settlement - If agreement is reached - jury trial must be cancelled no later than noon Wednesday January 27, 2016. Adj. 4:22 p.m.

2:51 p.m. Defendant Neil N. Roder in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm230, 15fo603 and 15fo604. Voorhees states no resolution has been reached - requests trial date with final pre-trial in advance.  Jury trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Brandy M. Miller

10:04 a.m.  Defendant Neil N. Roder in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15fo603, 15fo604 and 15cm230. Voorhees statement to Dr. Galli's report and stipulates to receipt of report.  Voorhees/defendant do not contest report. Court determines Dr. Galli accurately states 971.13 and finds defendant competent to proceed based on report. Voorhees/Michlig statement to bond - requests modification.  Currently set at $1000 cash with conditions. Court reduces bond to $500 cash bond; conditions remain. Bail is continued. Adj. 10:19 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Evaluation by Michael Galli, Ph.D.
States Reply to Discovery and State's Demand for Discovery

01:40 pm - Defendant Neil N. Roder in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Neil N. Roder in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 15fo603-04.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Voorhees raises issue of mental competency. Court orders examination.  Exam to be conducted at the jail.  Bail continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-01-2015 01:15 pm

01:54 pm - Defendant Neil N. Roder in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig requests an order under 940.47 concerning the no contact with Nicole DeCherrie provision of bond.  State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Letter written by Defendant to Victim) - Marked and Rec'd.  Defendant statements concerning contact w/DeCherrie and concerning Protective Payee status.  No contact WHATSOEVER with Nicole DeCherrie.  Court directs the defendant to contact the PD office.  Bail continued.
No contact with Nicole Decherrie - may not go upon premises of Decherri's residence, no intoxicants, no taverns

01:52 pm - Defendant Neil N. Roder in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Defendant states could stay in Appleton (father), LDF (sister).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
